newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Weak Dow pulls Manila shares down at close.
newsitem.headline: Weak Dow pulls Manila shares down at close.

text.p: * Late-session buying cuts part of early losses
The Philippine share index slumped by one percent at close despite a late-session attempt to revive the market battered by Wall Street's fall last night, brokers said.

"The market tried to recover at the end ... There were some investors picking up stocks which have gone down to attractive levels," Jose Maria Ricardo Garcia, research head of Diversified Securities, said.
The mild selldown was triggered by the steep fall in the U.S. stock market last night. "It's a good opportunity to cash in gains made in the past two days," Garcia added.
The composite index lost what it gained on Thursday, falling 31.65 points to close at 3,129.11, off the day's low of 3,112.37 points.
Ana Candelaria, investment analyst at Eastern Securities, said the bourse was expected to drift sideways on lack of market moving factors. Near-term support was seen at 3,100 points.
